entries.content: Frame the unique legal status of your product by comparing it to familiar legal items (e.g., cannabis seeds) to differentiate from illegal alternatives.
entries.notes: Used when explaining the THCA extract's legality in the UK.

entries.content: Explain the technical reason behind your product's unique status (e.g., THCA state) to build credibility and highlight differentiation.
entries.notes: Used when explaining why the THCA extract is legal.

entries.content: We got absolute fire. It's available to your door.
entries.notes: Value framing emphasizing quality and convenience.

entries.content: That is the strongest extract on the [__] planet.
Frame the core benefit of your service (e.g., algorithm trading) as passive income and freedom, contrasting implicitly with traditional work.
entries.notes: Highlighting the 'chilling and enjoying myself' aspect.

entries.content: Address potential objections about complexity or cost by highlighting accessibility and low barrier to entry ('any of you can do this with a few hundred').
entries.notes: Implicitly contrasts with the difficulty of starting traditional businesses.

entries.content: You can be making some nice money. Be 10 20 maybe 30% in a good month. That is crazy return.
It's something you can do to enjoy yourself live your life and print cash.
entries.notes: Summarizing the ultimate lifestyle benefit of the service.

entries.content: Using a testimonial: 'He's made 1,600 quid on top of what he's doing his tennis job.'
entries.notes: Validates the value proposition by showing real-world results alongside existing income.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
